title: [P5] GitHub Integration

title: [P3] Micro-Slicing Engine
description:
# Micro-Slicing Engine

Pre-slice skills into atomic blocks for optimal packing.

## Tasks
1. Define SliceSpec struct (id, type, content, tokens, policy)
2. Parse skills into slices during indexing
3. Store slices in skill_slices table
4. Tag slices with priority and policy flags
5. Build slice dependency graph

## Slice Types (from Section 5.2)
- CriticalRule (always include, mandatory)
- Command (executables, code snippets)
- Example (demonstrations)
- Pitfall (warnings, gotchas)
- Checklist (step-by-step)
- DecisionTree (conditional logic)
- Reference (links, citations)

## Slice Properties
- id: Unique identifier
- type: SliceType enum
- content: Markdown content
- token_count: Pre-computed
- policy: mandatory | optional | conditional
- predicates: Version/context conditions

## Dependency Tracking
- Some slices require others (e.g., example requires command)
- Store in skill_slice_deps table

## Acceptance Criteria
- Skills sliced during indexing
- Slice tokens counted accurately
- Dependencies tracked

description:
# Skill Versioning System

Semantic versions with migration support.

```rust
struct SkillVersion {
    version: semver::Version,
    changelog: String,
    breaking_changes: Vec<BreakingChange>,
    created_at: DateTime,
```

title: [P4] Provenance Graph
description:
# Provenance Graph

Link skill rules to source evidence.

## Tasks
1. Define ProvenanceRef struct
2. Store compressed pointers (session_id + byte range)
3. Fetch-on-demand for full evidence
4. Display in skill metadata
5. Support multiple sources per rule

## Provenance Storage (from Section 8.4)
- Compressed: Just pointers (session_id, start, end)
- Full evidence fetched on demand
- Reduces skill size by 10x+

## Data Model
```rust
struct ProvenanceRef {
    session_id: String,
    byte_start: usize,
    byte_end: usize,
    cached_excerpt: Option<String>,  // Optional inline cache
}

struct RuleProvenance {
    rule_id: String,
    sources: Vec<ProvenanceRef>,
}
```

## CLI
- `ms show skill --provenance` - Show evidence for each rule
- `ms trace rule-id` - Fetch full context for a rule

## Acceptance Criteria
- Provenance stored efficiently
- Full evidence fetchable
- Multiple sources per rule supported

title: [P6] Agent Mail Integration
description:
# Agent Mail Integration

Multi-agent skill coordination via Agent Mail MCP.

## Tasks
1. Agent Mail client integration
2. Skill announcement protocol
3. Pattern sharing between agents
4. Skill request/fulfillment
5. Swarm coordination

## Use Cases (from Section 20)
1. Share discovered patterns in real-time
2. Coordinate skill generation (avoid duplication)
3. Request skills from specialized agents
4. Notify when new skills ready

## Message Types
- skill_build_start: Agent starting skill generation
- skill_build_complete: Skill ready for use
- pattern_share: Sharing extracted patterns
- skill_request: Requesting skill from others
- skill_response: Responding to request

## Integration Pattern
```rust
struct AgentMailClient {
    project_key: String,
    agent_name: String,
    mcp_endpoint: String,
}

impl AgentMailClient {
    async fn announce_build_start(&self, topic: &str);
    async fn announce_build_complete(&self, skill_id: &str);
    async fn share_patterns(&self, patterns: &[Pattern]);
}
```

## Fallback
- If Agent Mail unavailable, local-only operation
- No blocking on network

## Acceptance Criteria
- Agents can coordinate skill building
- Patterns shared successfully
- Graceful fallback when offline

title: [P4] Pattern Extraction Pipeline
description:
# Pattern Extraction Pipeline

Mine patterns from CASS sessions.

## Tasks
1. Define Pattern IR (intermediate representation)
2. Implement extractors for different pattern types
3. Command extraction (shell commands, their context)
4. Solution extraction (what worked)
5. Pitfall extraction (what didn't work)
6. Frequency counting across sessions

## Pattern Types (from Section 8.2)
- Commands: Executed commands with context
- Solutions: Successful resolution patterns
- Pitfalls: Failure modes and fixes
- Workflows: Multi-step sequences
- Rules: Derived guidelines

## Pattern IR
```rust
struct ExtractedPattern {
    pattern_type: PatternType,
    content: String,
    frequency: u32,
    sessions: Vec<SessionRef>,
    confidence: f32,
    context: PatternContext,
}
```

## Extraction Algorithm
1. Query CASS for topic
2. Retrieve matching sessions
3. Parse session content
4. Identify pattern candidates
5. Aggregate by similarity
6. Rank by frequency + recency

## Acceptance Criteria
- Patterns extracted from sessions
- Frequency counted correctly
- Context preserved

title: Phase 2: Search (Hybrid Search Engine)
description:
# Phase 2: Search

Implement the hybrid search system combining BM25 + hash embeddings + RRF fusion.

## Core Components
1. **Tantivy integration** - BM25 full-text search on skill content
2. **Hash embeddings** - FNV-1a based, 384 dimensions, no ML dependency
3. **RRF fusion** - Reciprocal Rank Fusion to combine rankings
4. **Alias resolution** - Handle skill renames and deprecations
5. **Filter support** - By tech stack, tags, layer, type
6. **Search CLI** - `ms search` command with robot mode

## Key Design Decisions
- Hash embeddings from xf: 80-90% ML quality, zero dependencies
- Optional local ML embedder for higher fidelity (pluggable)
- Alias system preserves backward compatibility

## Success Criteria
- `ms search "query"` returns ranked results
- `ms search --robot "query"` returns JSON
- Filters work correctly
- Alias resolution works transparently
- Sub-50ms p99 search latency

title: Phase 4: CASS Integration (Skill Mining)
description:
# Phase 4: CASS Integration

The killer feature: generating skills from CASS session history.

## Core Components
1. **CASS client** - Subprocess integration with robot mode
2. **Pattern extraction** - Mine commands, solutions, pitfalls from sessions
3. **Pattern IR** - Typed intermediate representation
4. **Specific-to-general transformation** - Extract universal patterns
5. **Session marking** - Mark sessions as exemplary/anti-pattern
6. **Provenance graph** - Link rules to evidence
7. **Redaction pipeline** - Strip secrets/PII before extraction
8. **Taint tracking** - Ensure unsafe content never leaks
9. **Interactive build TUI** - Guided skill generation
10. **Autonomous generation** - Hours-long checkpointed builds
11. **Session quality scoring** - Filter low-quality sessions
12. **Anti-pattern mining** - Extract what NOT to do
13. **Uncertainty queue** - Active learning for low-confidence patterns

## Key Design Decisions
- Brenner Method: extract generative grammar, not summaries
- Counterexamples are first-class patterns
- Steady-state detection for convergence
- Provenance is compressed (pointer + fetch on demand)

## Success Criteria
- `ms build --from-cass "topic"` extracts patterns
- `ms build --guided` runs interactive TUI
- `ms build --autonomous --duration 4h` runs with checkpoints
- Generated skills include provenance links
- Redaction prevents secrets in output

title: [P2] RRF Score Fusion
description:
# RRF Score Fusion

Combine BM25 and embedding rankings using Reciprocal Rank Fusion.

## Tasks
1. Implement RRF algorithm
2. Configure rank constant k (default 60)
3. Configurable weighting between BM25 and embedding
4. Tie-breaking strategy
5. Score explanation in verbose mode

## Algorithm (from Section 6.3)
```
RRF(doc) = Σ 1 / (k + rank_i(doc))
```

Where:
- k = smoothing constant (60 is standard)
- rank_i = rank from ranking system i

## Fusion Configuration
```yaml
search:
  bm25_weight: 0.6
  embedding_weight: 0.4
  rrf_k: 60
```

## Debug Output
For --verbose, show:
- BM25 rank for each result
- Embedding rank for each result
- Final fused score

## Acceptance Criteria
- Fusion improves result quality
- Configuration is tunable
- Verbose mode shows score breakdown

title: [P3] Token Packer (Constrained Optimization)
description:
# Token Packer (Constrained Optimization)

Fit slices into token budget optimally.

## Tasks
1. Implement packing algorithm (not greedy)
2. Respect mandatory policy slices
3. Maximize value within budget
4. Handle slice dependencies
5. Output packed markdown

## Algorithm (from Section 5.3)
1. Start with mandatory slices
2. Calculate remaining budget
3. Apply constrained optimization
4. Respect dependencies (if A, must include B)
5. Return optimal slice selection

## Optimization Target
```
maximize: Σ value(slice) * selected(slice)
subject to: Σ tokens(slice) * selected(slice) ≤ budget
            mandatory(slice) → selected(slice) = 1
            depends(A, B) → selected(A) ≤ selected(B)
```

## CLI Integration
- `ms load skill --pack 2000` - fit in 2000 tokens
- `ms load skill --pack auto` - auto-detect budget

## Acceptance Criteria
- Packer respects budget
- Mandatory slices always included
- Dependencies satisfied

# Session Quality Scoring

Filter low-quality sessions from extraction.

## Tasks
1. Define quality metrics
2. Implement scoring algorithm
3. Store scores in SQLite
4. Filter sessions below threshold
5. Update scores over time

## Quality Metrics (from Section 8.8)
- Completion: Did session reach goal?
- Errors: How many failed attempts?
- Retries: Excessive retries indicate struggles
- Duration: Too short or too long
- Tool usage: Diverse vs repetitive

## Scoring Algorithm
```rust
fn score_session(session: &Session) -> f32 {
    let completion_score = if session.completed { 1.0 } else { 0.5 };
    let error_penalty = (session.error_count as f32 * 0.05).min(0.3);
    let retry_penalty = (session.retry_count as f32 * 0.02).min(0.2);
    let duration_score = score_duration(session.duration);
    
    (completion_score - error_penalty - retry_penalty + duration_score) / 2.0
}
```

## Threshold
- Default: 0.6
- Configurable via config
- Sessions below threshold excluded from extraction

## Acceptance Criteria
- Sessions scored on quality
- Low-quality sessions filtered
- Scores update with new data

```sql
    id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    skill_id TEXT,
    session_id TEXT,
    outcome TEXT,  -- success, failure, unknown
    loaded_at TIMESTAMP,
    feedback TEXT  -- positive, negative, null
);
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- Usage tracked automatically
- Effectiveness scores computed
- A/B framework functional

title: [P3] Disclosure Levels System
description:
# Disclosure Levels System

Progressive disclosure from minimal (~100 tokens) to full.

## Tasks
1. Define DisclosureLevel enum (minimal, overview, operational, reference, full)
2. Implement level selection in ms load command
3. Implement level-based content filtering
4. Token counting for each level
5. Level recommendation based on context

## Disclosure Levels (from Section 5.1)
| Level | Tokens | Use Case |
|-------|--------|----------|
| minimal | ~100 | Trigger words, quick reminder |
| overview | ~300 | High-level understanding |
| operational | ~800 | Enough to execute |
| reference | ~1500 | Detailed with examples |
| full | unlimited | Complete with edge cases |

## Level Selection Algorithm
- Start with minimal
- If query suggests execution, escalate to operational
- If troubleshooting, escalate to reference
- Agent can request higher levels

## Acceptance Criteria
- `ms load skill --level overview` works
- Token counts approximately match targets
- Level escalation works

title: [P5] Local Modification Safety
description:
# Local Modification Safety

Preserve user customizations on bundle updates.

## Tasks
1. Three-tier storage: upstream, local, merged
2. Detect local modifications
3. Generate patches for local changes
4. Apply patches after update
5. Conflict detection and resolution UI

## Storage Tiers (from Section 9.3)
```
.ms/skills/
├── upstream/     # Original from bundle
├── local/        # User modifications
└── merged/       # Effective content
```

## Modification Tracking
- Store original hash from bundle
- Compare current to original
- Generate unified diff for changes

## Update Flow
1. Download new upstream version
2. Check for local modifications
3. If no mods: replace directly
4. If mods: three-way merge
5. Conflict? Show diff and ask user

## Conflict Resolution
- Show side-by-side diff
- Options: keep local, take upstream, merge
- Save resolution for future

## Acceptance Criteria
- Local changes survive updates
- Conflicts detected and surfaced
- Resolution is clear and safe

title: [P3] Meta-Skills (Composed Bundles)
description:
# Meta-Skills (Composed Bundles)

Skills that compose slices from multiple skills.

## Tasks
1. Define MetaSkill spec format
2. Cross-skill slice references
3. Deduplication of overlapping content
4. Coherent ordering of composed slices
5. CLI for meta-skill creation

## Meta-Skill Spec (from Section 5.5)
```yaml
name: react-debugging
type: meta-skill
compose:
  - skill: react/hooks
    slices: [pitfall-1, pitfall-2]
  - skill: typescript/strict
    slices: [rule-1, rule-2]
  - skill: chrome-devtools
    slices: [command-inspect]
```

## Use Cases
- Combine debugging skills for specific stack
- Create role-specific skill bundles
- Curate onboarding sets

## Coherence
- Slices ordered by type (rules → commands → examples)
- Duplicates removed (same content from multiple sources)
- Transitions smoothed

## Acceptance Criteria
- Meta-skills compose correctly
- Duplicates deduplicated
- Order is logical

title: [P6] MCP Server Mode
description:
# MCP Server Mode

Native agent tool-use integration via MCP protocol.

## Tasks
1. Implement MCP server using mcp-rust-sdk
2. Define tool schemas for all commands
3. Handle tool calls
4. Streaming responses
5. Resource exposure for skills

## MCP Tools Exposed
- ms_search: Search skills
- ms_load: Load skill content
- ms_suggest: Get suggestions
- ms_list: List skills
- ms_show: Show skill details

## Tool Schemas
```json
{
  "name": "ms_search",
  "description": "Search for skills matching a query",
  "inputSchema": {
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
      "query": {"type": "string"},
      "limit": {"type": "integer", "default": 10}
    },
    "required": ["query"]
  }
}
```

## Benefits over Subprocess
- No process spawn overhead
- Persistent connection
- Streaming support
- Type-safe schemas

## CLI
- `ms mcp serve` - Start MCP server
- Listens on stdin/stdout (standard MCP transport)

## Acceptance Criteria
- MCP server implements full protocol
- All commands exposed as tools
- Works with Claude desktop, etc.

title: [P4] Autonomous Build Mode
description:
# Autonomous Build Mode

Long-running skill generation with checkpoints.

## Tasks
1. Define BuildSession state machine
2. Implement checkpointing to disk
3. Recovery from interrupted sessions
4. Progress reporting
5. Quality gates between phases

## Autonomous Mode (from Section 8.7)
- `ms build --autonomous --duration 4h`
- Runs unattended for specified duration
- Checkpoints every N minutes
- Can be interrupted and resumed

## Build Phases
1. Discovery: Find relevant sessions
2. Extraction: Pull patterns from sessions
3. Aggregation: Cluster similar patterns
4. Transformation: Generalize patterns
5. Compilation: Generate skill spec
6. Validation: Test against held-out sessions

## Checkpoint Format
```rust
struct BuildCheckpoint {
    session_id: String,
    phase: BuildPhase,
    state: serde_json::Value,
    created_at: DateTime,
    patterns_so_far: Vec<ExtractedPattern>,
}
```

## CLI
- `ms build --autonomous --duration 4h`
- `ms build --resume <session_id>`
- `ms build --status` - Check running builds

## Acceptance Criteria
- Builds run for hours unattended
- Checkpoints enable resume
- Quality gates prevent garbage

title: [P1] Robot Mode Infrastructure
description:
# Robot Mode Infrastructure

Machine-readable JSON output for all commands.

## Tasks
1. Define RobotResponse<T> wrapper struct
2. Define StatusResponse enum (success, error, approval_required)
3. Implement --robot flag parsing
4. Separate stdout (data) from stderr (diagnostics)
5. Consistent exit codes
6. Schema versioning

## Robot Mode Protocol (from Section 4.5)
- stdout = valid JSON only
- stderr = diagnostics, progress, errors
- Exit 0 = success, non-zero = failure
- Schema documented and versioned

## Response Format
```json
{
  "status": "success",
  "timestamp": "2026-01-13T12:00:00Z",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "data": { ... }
}
```

## Error Format
```json
{
  "status": "error",
  "error": {
    "code": "skill_not_found",
    "message": "Skill 'foo' not found",
    "hint": "Run 'ms list' to see available skills"
  }
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- All commands have --robot flag
- JSON is always valid on stdout
- Exit codes are consistent

title: Phase 3: Disclosure & Suggestions
description:
# Phase 3: Disclosure & Suggestions

Progressive disclosure system and context-aware skill suggestions.

## Core Components
1. **Disclosure levels** - minimal (~100 tokens) → full (complete)
2. **Micro-slicing** - Pre-slice skills into atomic blocks
3. **Token packing** - Constrained optimization to fit budget
4. **Conditional predicates** - Version-specific content filtering
5. **Context-aware suggestions** - Based on cwd, files, commands
6. **Swarm planning** - Multi-agent pack coordination (for NTM)
7. **Meta-skills** - Composed slice bundles
8. **Suggestion cooldowns** - Context fingerprints to prevent spam

## Key Design Decisions
- Slices are atomic: rule, command, example, pitfall
- Packer uses constrained optimization, not greedy
- Mandatory policy slices cannot be omitted
- Predicates evaluated at load time, not by agent

## Success Criteria
- `ms load <skill> --level overview` works
- `ms load <skill> --pack 2000` respects token budget
- `ms suggest --cwd .` returns context-relevant skills
- Predicate filtering strips irrelevant version content

title: Phase 5: Bundles & Distribution
description:
# Phase 5: Bundles & Distribution

Skill sharing, bundling, and multi-machine synchronization.

## Core Components
1. **Bundle format** - YAML manifest with skills + metadata
2. **GitHub integration** - Publish/install from GitHub releases
3. **Local modification safety** - Preserve customizations on update
4. **Sync engine** - Three-way merge with conflict resolution
5. **Multi-machine sync** - Machine identity, sync state tracking
6. **One-URL sharing** - Share entire skill set via single URL
7. **Backup system** - Automatic backups with retention

## Key Design Decisions
- Three-tier storage: upstream, local mods, merged
- Conflict resolution is proposal-first
- Patches stored, not full copies
- SHA256 verification on install

## Success Criteria
- `ms bundle create my-skills` packages skills
- `ms bundle publish --repo user/skills` pushes to GitHub
- `ms bundle install user/skills` works
- Local modifications survive updates
- Conflict resolution surfaces differences clearly

title: [P4] Session Marking System
description:
# Session Marking System

Mark sessions as exemplary or anti-pattern for training.

## Tasks
1. Define SessionMark enum (exemplary, anti-pattern, neutral)
2. Store marks in SQLite
3. CLI for marking sessions
4. Weight marks in extraction
5. Propagate marks to patterns

## Marking Types
- exemplary: High-quality work, use for positive examples
- anti-pattern: What not to do, use for pitfall extraction
- neutral: Default, neither good nor bad

## Storage
```sql
CREATE TABLE session_marks (
    session_id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    mark TEXT NOT NULL,
    marked_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    reason TEXT
);
```

## CLI
- `ms mark <session_id> exemplary --reason "Clean workflow"`
- `ms mark <session_id> anti-pattern --reason "Bad error handling"`
- `ms marks list` - Show marked sessions

## Impact on Extraction
- Exemplary: Higher weight in pattern aggregation
- Anti-pattern: Used for counterexample extraction
- Neutral: Standard weight

## Acceptance Criteria
- Sessions can be marked
- Marks affect extraction weighting
- Anti-patterns become pitfalls

title: [P5] Multi-Machine Sync
description:
# Multi-Machine Sync

Synchronize skills across multiple machines.

## Tasks
1. Machine identity (unique ID per installation)
2. Sync state tracking
3. Conflict detection across machines
4. Push/pull operations
5. Optional Git-based sync backend

## Machine Identity
- Generate UUID on first run
- Store in .ms/machine_id
- Include in sync metadata

## Sync State
```sql
CREATE TABLE sync_state (
    skill_id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    local_version TEXT,
    remote_version TEXT,
    last_synced TIMESTAMP,
    machine_id TEXT
);
```

## Sync Protocol
1. `ms sync pull` - Fetch changes from remote
2. `ms sync push` - Push local changes to remote
3. `ms sync status` - Show pending changes
4. Auto-sync on bundle operations

## Git Backend (Optional)
- Store skills in Git repo
- Sync via git pull/push
- Leverage Git merge for conflicts

## Acceptance Criteria
- Sync works across machines
- Conflicts detected and resolved
- Git backend optional but supported

title: [P4] ms build Command
description:
# ms build Command

Main interface for skill generation from CASS.

## Subcommands
- `ms build --from-cass "topic"` - Extract from sessions
- `ms build --guided` - Interactive TUI
- `ms build --autonomous` - Long-running mode
- `ms build --resume <id>` - Resume interrupted
- `ms build --dry-run` - Preview without saving

## Options
- --topic: Search topic for sessions
- --sessions: Specific session IDs
- --min-quality: Quality threshold
- --duration: Autonomous duration
- --output: Output directory
- --robot: JSON output

## Workflow
1. Query CASS for relevant sessions
2. Score and filter sessions
3. Extract patterns
4. Transform to general rules
5. Compile skill spec
6. Save and index

## Output
- skill.spec.yaml in output directory
- Compiled SKILL.md
- provenance.json with evidence links

## Acceptance Criteria
- All modes work correctly
- Skills saved and indexed
- Provenance preserved
